body:
It looks like `rkt run` got changed and k8s cannot start pods, tried on latest CoreOS 833 and 766 builds:

```
kubectl describe pod my-nginx-kre94
Name:               my-nginx-kre94
Namespace:          default
Image(s):           nginx
Node:               172.19.17.99/
Labels:             run=my-nginx
Status:             Pending
Reason:             GeneralError
Message:            Query container info failed with error (cannot find status for pod: "my-nginx-kre94_default")
IP:
Replication Controllers:    my-nginx (2/2 replicas created)
Containers:
  my-nginx:
    Image:      nginx
    State:      Waiting
    Ready:      False
    Restart Count:  0
Events:
  FirstSeen             LastSeen            Count   From            SubobjectPath   Reason      Message
  Wed, 14 Oct 2015 09:39:09 -0600   Wed, 14 Oct 2015 09:39:09 -0600 1   {scheduler }                scheduled   Successfully assigned my-nginx-kre94 to 172.19.17.99
  Wed, 14 Oct 2015 09:39:09 -0600   Wed, 14 Oct 2015 09:39:50 -0600 6   {kubelet 172.19.17.99}          failedSync  Error syncing pod, skipping: invalid output: [NAME:     image cat-manifest - Inspect and print the image manifest  USAGE:   rkt image cat-manifest IMAGE  DESCRIPTION:  IMAGE should be a string referencing an image; either a hash or an image name.  OPTIONS:   -h, --help=false: help for cat-manifest       --pretty-print=false: apply indent to format the output  GLOBAL OPTIONS:       --debug=false: Print out more debug information to stderr       --dir="/var/lib/rkt": rkt data directory       --insecure-skip-verify=false: skip all TLS, image or fingerprint verification       --local-config="/etc/rkt": local configuration directory       --system-config="/usr/lib/rkt": system configuration directory]
```

labels.description: Must be staffed and worked on either currently, or very soon, ideally in time for the next release.
labels.name: priority/important-soon

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Node.
labels.name: sig/node

title: rkt does not work on latest k8s v1.0.6 on CoreOS
